ratings.note: Bonds described as IG in loan documents. Vivendi parent provides support.

overview.business_description: International media and retail group with two main divisions: Hachette Livre (leading global book publisher) and Lagardère Travel Retail (travel retail/duty-free in airports, train stations). Acquired by Vivendi in 2022-2023.
business_positives: Very low distress score of 6 - strong performing credit
Hachette Livre is #3 global book publisher
Travel retail benefits from air travel recovery
overview.fatal_flaw: Structural challenges in traditional publishing. Travel retail competitive with Avolta/Dufry. Vivendi may monetize assets. EUR 500m Oct 2026 maturity approaching.
overview.ownership: Vivendi (French media conglomerate). Public equity (Paris: MMB) with $3.1bn market cap.
overview.recent_news: EUR 500m five-year bond launched Jun 2025. Vivendi acquired Lagardère (2022-23). EUR 2.2bn IG loan facility signed Jun 2024.

trend_analysis.trend_summary: Strong EBITDA growth and deleveraging. Leverage down from 4.4x to 2.7x.

credit_opinion.summary: Lagardère is a strong performing credit with very low distress score (6). Excellent deleveraging from 4.4x to 2.7x gross leverage. EBITDA has grown 71% since 2022 with margin expansion. Strong CFFO of $1.5bn. Vivendi ownership provides strategic support. Net leverage at just 2.3x is conservative. Bonds trading near par (97-103). The combination of leading publishing (Hachette) and travel retail creates a diversified media group.
key_risks: Structural challenges in traditional book publishing
key_catalysts: Continued EBITDA growth from travel retail recovery
Rating upgrade if leverage sustains below 2.5x

distress_indicators.trading_signals: Bonds at 97-103 (near/above par). IG loan facility. Very low distress score. Strong Vivendi backing.
